intro: Lamprostachys rosea, commonly known as the rose-flowered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pale pink to deep rose. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
